xxl.applications.indexStructures
Class Tests

java.lang.Object
  xxl.applications.indexStructures.Tests

public class Tests
extends Object

This class provides several static methods which are useful for for preparing tests of indexstructures.

Nested Class Summary

          A class to represent the data objects which are stored in an index structure.

Method Detail

waitForUser

public static void waitForUser()
It makes the program wait for an input from the user.

createKeys

public static void createKeys(String fileName,
                              int nr,
                              int low,
                              int high)
                       throws IOException
Creates random nr keys from [low, high[ and stores thme into the file with the given file name. In the file each key lies in a separate line.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file into which the created keys have to be stored
nr - the number of the keys which have to be created
low - the minimal bound of key range
high - the maximal bound of the key range
Throws:
IOException

createKeys

public static void createKeys(int low,
                              int high,
                              int jump)
                       throws IOException
For each interval [k, l[ of [low, low+jump[, [low+jump, low+2jump[, ..., [low+(n-1)jump, low+n*jump[, where n is the greatest integer so that n*jump is smaller than high, creates randomly keys by calling the the method createKeys(String fileName, int nr, int k, int l). The fileName is WORK_DIR_NAME+"/Keys"+k+"_"+l+".test" and nr equals 2*(l-k)/3.

Parameters:
low - the minimal bound of key range
high - the maximal bound of the key range
jump - the length of the intervals
Throws:
IOException

createKeys

public static void createKeys(int high)
                       throws IOException
It is equivalent to: 

                                createKeys(0, high, 1000);

Parameters:
high - the maximal bound of the key range
Throws:
IOException

makeInsertTestFile

public static void makeInsertTestFile(String[] keysFiles,
                                      String fileName)
                               throws IOException
Merges the contents of all given files randomly and add simultaneously an "incom" component for each key (personal number) (see Tests.Employee). The result is written into the file with the given file name fileName.

Parameters:
keysFiles - files containig the keys
fileName - the name of the result file
Throws:
IOException

getKeysFiles

public static String[] getKeysFiles(int low,
                                    int high,
                                    int jump)
Gives the names of the files which were created at last by calling the method createKeys(int low, int high, int jump).

Parameters:
low - the minimal bound of key range
high - the maximal bound of the key range
jump - the length of the intervals
Returns:
an Array containig the file names

getKeysFiles

public static String[] getKeysFiles(int high)
Is equivalent to: 

                        getKeysFiles(0, high, 1000);

Parameters:
high - the maximal bound of the key range
Returns:
an Array containig the file names

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws IOException
Throws:
